item.title: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .
item.dc:creator: Lord_Grievous
item.description:
C:\Program Files\Steam\SteamApps\UserName\Gmod

If you’re using Windows 64bit than look in Program Files (x86)

In your gmod folder there should be some folders called addons, and materials or something.

Read full topic
item.source: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .

item.title: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .
item.dc:creator: blackout
item.description:
ok thank you, but where in the directory do I paste the files?

Read full topic
item.source: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .

item.title: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .
item.dc:creator: Lord_Grievous
item.description:
There’s a difference between not being very tech savvy and not even knowing how to copy&paste something :meh:

To copy&paste something, right-click the folders you want to copy and click Copy from the menu, then go the Gmod main directory and right-click again, select Paste.

Alternatively you can select the folders you want to copy and press Ctrl+C and then click Ctrl+V to paste.

Read full topic

item.description:

and it didn’t work ramirezoid, I did somehting wrong. can youy explain the copy and paste part again?

many thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .

item.title: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .
item.dc:creator: Lord_Grievous
item.description:
After you’ve extracted the RAR you should have a bunch of folders, in your Gmod main directory you should also find some of these foders. Copy the extracted folders and copy&paste them into the main directory (somewhere in Program Files/STEAM/Steamapps/username I suppose).

Read full topic

item.source: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .

item.title: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
easiest way:

right click your gmod icon
click “Openfile location”
click the folder named “steamapps”
then click the folder that says your name
then click “garrysmod”
then click the other “garrysmod”
then copy 'n paste the addon in there.

Read full topic
item.source: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .

item.title: so I just downloaded HL: Renaissance. . .
item.dc:creator: Lord_Grievous
item.description:
Copy all the folders into your Gmod main directory, when it prompts to overwrite, say yes.
